intro: Fumaria muralis proles vagans, commonly known as the wandering wallflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-orange flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils, often found along walls or in crevices. Its flowers bloom in early summer and are pollinated by insects such as bees and flies. The species is known for its ability to spread through seeds dispersed by wind or animals, contributing to its wide distribution.
